details.name: Increased Authentication Errors in Multiple Environments

incident_updates.body:
We experienced a service disruption due to an issue with one of our upstream providers. Impacted customers received error messages related to a temporary failure in the DNS lookup process from ~09:45 to ~10:10 UTC. The issue had self-resolved, and no actions are required from our customers. We are continuing to monitor the situation and evaluate alternative solutions to enhance the resiliency of our services.

We apologize for the impact this has caused you and your users.

affected_components.name: Auth0 US (PROD) - Machine to Machine Authentication
Auth0 US-4 (PROD) - Machine to Machine Authentication

incident_updates.body: Our monitoring alerted us to increased failures in our networking edge at approximately 09:45 UTC on December 5, 2024. Simultaneously, our Support team began receiving reports that customers are experiencing increased errors when attempting to login.

affected_components.name: Auth0 US (PROD) - Machine to Machine Authentication
Auth0 US-4 (PROD) - Machine to Machine Authentication

incident_updates.body: Services has been restored. A root cause analysis (RCA) will be posted here within 14 days. We sincerely apologize for the impact this had on you and your users.
The Manage service has been restored following the implementation of mitigation measures. We have placed additional safeguards to prevent recurrence and will continue to monitor the situation.

We have identified that the Manage service has not fully recovered. Impacted users may experience temporary disruptions accessing the Auth0 Dashboard. Our teams are actively working to resolve the issue. We will provide another update within the next 30 minutes.

The impacted services (https://manage.auth0.com, https://status.auth0.com and https://support.auth0.com) are currently recovering and we will continue to monitor the situation. If you are unable to access these resources, please try logging in again.
We have identified the root cause of the issue and are implementing a fix. We will continue to update every 15 minutes.
We are continuing to investigate an ongoing issue where the Dashboard and the Auth0 Support Center might be temporarily unavailable.

The Auth0 Manage Dashboard is unavailable, and our Engineers have been alerted. This does not affect your authentication transactions, and you can still make management transactions via our Management API.  Our team is actively working to understand the root cause and mitigate the issue. We will provide updates as we gather more information.

The errors stopped at approximately 20:11 UTC and we have not seen any additional spikes at this time.  Our engineering team is continuing to investigate the root cause of the issue. We will provide an analysis within 14 days.  We sincerely apologize for the impact this had on you and your users.
We applied a fix for the issue and are monitoring the system.

We are currently investigating an incident that impacted our services. Affected users are experiencing issues with Manage Dashboard. We are not seeing errors in Authentication and Management APIs at this time. Our team is actively working to understand the root cause and mitigate the issue. We will provide updates as we gather more information.
Services has been restored. A root cause analysis (RCA) will be posted here within 14 days. We sincerely apologize for the impact this had on you and your users.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Users may have experienced an issue where administrators have partial account visibility when accessing the Manage Dashboard. We have identified the root cause and applied a fix.  There is no active impact and we are continuing to monitor the situation.

We are currently investigating an incident that impacted our services. Our team is actively working to understand the root cause and mitigate the issue. We will provide updates as we gather more information.

incident_updates.body: Services has been restored. A root cause analysis (RCA) will be posted here within 14 days. We sincerely apologize for the impact this had on you and your users.

affected_components.name: Auth0 US-4 (PROD) - Machine to Machine Authentication

details.name: Elevated Errors in EU Public Cloud Environment

incident_updates.body: Following thorough investigation by our Engineering team this issue did not in fact have broad customer impact and was not the result of a broad regression. We have further analyzed the errors and confirmed they were isolated to a single customer environment. We are continuing to work with our Support team on helping assist customers with the error in question and no additional customer action is required to remediate this issue. Please contact our Support team should you have any additional questions or concerns.
incident_updates.custom_tweet: We published a postmortem on our February 9th incident: https://stspg.io/swsdzxwmyyq2

incident_updates.body: The errors were self-resolved, and the services have been stable. We will continue to investigate the issue’s root cause and provide an analysis within 14 days.  We sincerely apologize for the impact this had on you and your users.

affected_components.name: Auth0 Europe (PROD) - Machine to Machine Authentication

incident_updates.body: Between 22:38 and 22:47 UTC, we experienced elevated errors in our EU-1 public cloud environment. Users who were affected would have experienced 5XX error codes or latency when attempting to log in. There is no active impact, and no actions are required from our customers.
